description: The 'draw_decimal_comparison' function generates a series of visual models for comparing decimal numbers. It is designed to aid in the understanding of decimal comparison, following the Common Core State Standards for Mathematics (CCSS.MATH.CONTENT.4.NF.C.7+3).

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Decimal Comparison Visual Models
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'draw_decimal_comparison' function creates visual models for comparing decimal numbers. It accepts a list of decimal comparisons as input, each of which is represented as a pair of decimal numbers. The function generates a separate visualization for each comparison in the list, with each visualization consisting of a pair of side-by-side grids representing the two decimal numbers. The visualizations are designed to help students understand the concept of decimal comparison and are aligned with the CCSS.MATH.CONTENT.4.NF.C.7+3 standards. The function saves each visualization as an image file and returns the file name.

details: The function accepts a single input parameter: 'stimulus'. This is an instance of the DecimalComparisonList class, which contains a list of decimal comparisons.
Each decimal comparison is represented as a pair of decimal numbers.
The function generates a separate visualization for each comparison in the list.
The function assumes that the input parameter 'stimulus' is an instance of the DecimalComparisonList class.
Each decimal comparison in the list should be a pair of decimal numbers.
The function does not impose any specific constraints on the decimal numbers, but they should be valid decimal numbers in order to generate meaningful visualizations.
The function generates a separate visualization for each decimal comparison in the input list.
Each visualization consists of a pair of side-by-side grids representing the two decimal numbers.
The visualizations are designed to help students understand the concept of decimal comparison.

educational_standards.description: Compare two decimals to the hundredths place using models.
